item.title: Twitter down for some users in the U.S.
item.description: More than 4,500 users in the United States reported issues with accessing the social media site

item.title: A new chip for mobiles to block unwanted signals
item.description: MIT researchers created a new chip for mobile devices to block unwanted signals that affect smartphone performance

item.title: Vivo launches V27 Pro and V27 featuring MediaTek Dimensity SoC
item.description: Vivo expanded its V-series and launched the V27 Pro and the V27 smartphones for Indian buyers

item.title: India climbs 49 places on Ookla Speedtest Global Index, mobile speeds increase by 115%
item.description: India climbed 49 places on the Ookla Speedtest Global Index since the launch of 5G with median download speeds increasing by 115%

item.title: Google expands privacy controls in Workspace; adds client-side encryption in Gmail and Calendar
item.description: Client-side encryption, already available for other Google Workspace offerings, secures user data even if there a breach in Google’s servers

item.title: Meta’s first smart glasses with display may release in 2025; AR glasses in 2027
item.description: Meta is planning to release a series of products that leverage VR and AR technology in the next four years, including smart glasses and headsets

item.title: Tecno launches its first foldable phone Phantom V Fold
item.description: Tecno released its first foldable smartphone, the Phantom V Fold, during the Mobile World Congress

item.title: Indian telecom operators surpass 3-year 5G rollout target in six months
item.description: Telecom Additional Secretary V.L. Kantha Rao said that more than rolling out 5G services for consumers, it is very important that there is a rollout of 5G use cases for industry, education, health, agriculture

item.title: Explained | European Commission bans Tiktok on staff devices
item.description: TikTok has largely evaded European Union efforts to rein in its tech industry in accordance with their laws. But now the European Commission has banned TikTok from its staff devices

item.title: Realme announces GT3 featuring 240W fast charger
item.description: The Realme GT3 brings triple rear lens setup with a 240W fast charge that can charge the phone completely in just above 9 minutes

item.title: European Parliament to ban TikTok from staff phones, EU official says
item.description: The European Parliament decided to ban video-sharing app TikTok from staff phones for security reasons

item.title: Microsoft adds new Bing to Windows computers in effort to roll out AI
item.description: Microsoft started adding its recently upgraded AI-powered Bing search engine to its Windows computer software

item.title: India leads world in cutting internet access for 5th year in a row: report
item.description: “Authorities disrupted internet access at least 49 times in Kashmir due to political instability and violence,” a new report says

item.title: Explained | What are the two lawsuits in the U.S. Supreme Court which could change the internet as we know it?
item.description: Multiple tech companies including Meta, Microsoft, and Reddit have urged SCOTUS not to alter the law that protects them from liabilities and a potential barrage of lawsuits

item.title: Xiaomi’s Leica-powered phone goes official in India
item.description: Xiaomi officially launched the price details and availability of its second Leica-powered smartphone, the Xiaomi 13 Pro

item.title: AI learns to outsmart humans in video games — and real life
item.description: Video game players have competed against computer-controlled opponents for decades, but they haven't been as smart and fast as GT Sophy, the new AI driver on PlayStation's Gran Turismo

item.description: Meta CEO Mark Zuckerberg announced the news of a generative AI product group through his new Instagram channel

India’s semiconductor market to reach $55 billion by 2026: Deloitte
item.description: A report by Deloitte estimated that the Indian semiconductor market may reach $55 billion by 2026 with more than 60% of the market being driven by three industries

item.title: Portal opened for complaints against decisions of social media platforms
item.description: The portal will allow users to appeal against decisions taken by social media platforms to take down — or retain — content posted by users.

item.description: MIT researchers have built an augmented reality headset called X-AR that lets users see hidden objects inside a box or under a pile

item.description: Oppo showcased a string of its latest innovations at the ongoing Mobile World Congress (MWC) 2023, including the Find N2 Flip, Wi-Fi 6 Router, Zero-Power Tag, MariSilicon Y Bluetooth audio SoC, Air Glass 2, and more

item.title: Technology use will help India become developed nation by 2047: PM Modi
item.description: India is creating a modern digital infrastructure, and ensuring that benefits of digital revolution reach everyone, PM Modi noted.

item.description: Intel launches 4th Gen Xenon Scalable processors, Infrastructure Power Manager for 5G core reference software

item.description: The McAfee Consumer Mobile Threat Report found that advancements in AI chatbots and image generators could to lead to new mobile threats and aid scammers

item.description: Snap Inc., owner of Snapchat, said it is rolling out an artificial intelligence chatbot powered by OpenAI’s ChatGPT technology

item.description: The OnePlus 11 Concept is said to feature Active CryoFlux for enhanced cooling as it caters to aggressive gamers

item.description: The new logo comprises five different shapes forming the word NOKIA

item.description: Google under its Vulnerability Reward Programs paid over $12 million to bounty hunters who helped identify and fix over 2,900 security issues throughout 2022

item.title: Explained | The multi-year attack on GoDaddy servers and its impact
item.description: The attack on GoDaddy servers in December 2022 resulted in threat actors accessing the company’s shared servers, obtaining pieces of code and installing malware that intermittently redirected random customer websites to malicious sites

item.description: U.S. Secretary of State Antony Blinken said the U.S. government spoke to Elon Musk about Starlink satellite internet in Ukraine

item.title: Morning Digest | SIT on Morbi bridge tragedy finds lapses in repairs, maintenance; Chandrayaan-3 lander completes EMI-EMC test, and more
item.description: Here’s a select list of stories to read before you start your day.

item.title: Facebook-owner Meta to roll out paid subscription
item.description: "This new feature is about increasing authenticity and security across our services," Mark Zuckerberg wrote in a statement posted to his Facebook account.

item.title: J&K bars government staff from criticising policies online
item.description: J&K administration’s directions come amid ongoing anti-encroachment drive which evoked criticism from several sections of the society in the UT

item.title: An app that gamifies e-commerce experience
item.description: Dreampot, an e-commerce application by a Kochi-based start-up, allows users to own a smartphone or a gadget at 1% of its MRP

item.title: Elon Musk says artificial tweet boost reports false, spread by “disgruntled” Twitter employee
item.description: Elon Musk claimed that reports which said he had artificially boosted his tweets were false, and that they could be traced back to a Twitter employee with a grudge

item.title: YouTube CPO Neal Mohan to take over after former CEO Susan Wojcicki steps down
item.description: In a personal update, outgoing CEO Susan Wojcicki introduced Neal Mohan and his past accomplishments at Google and YouTube

item.title: Men held for cheating over 100 people impersonating 'high-profile' individuals
item.description: The matter came to light in January, when a victim approached police saying that someone was using his photograph on WhatsApp as a display picture and was asking for money from his relatives and friends.

item.description: Multiple security bugs affecting the security of software from Apple, Microsoft Edge, Google Chrome and Adobe were reported

item.title: Microsoft limits Bing chats to 5 questions per session
item.description: Microsoft is limiting users’ chat sessions with the new AI powered Bing search engine after reports of unexpected results and unsettling replies

item.title: Twitter will charge users to secure accounts via text message
item.description: Twitter announced that only Twitter Blue subscribers will be able to use text messages to secure their accounts through 2FA

item.title: Tech layoffs happening in US, not India, says Union Minister
item.description: Union Minister Rajeev Chandrasekhar also said that 18 lakh jobs have been added to the technology and electronic sector in the last two years and claimed that unlike in the past there is a reverse brain drain now with youngsters setting up start-ups and joining companies in India
